attributes.action: scrap the database of electronic information regarding phonecalls and emails.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: BBC news today announced that ministers are debating to have a centralised database holding all calls and emails ever sent in the UK. This is deeply disturbing for many reason. It seems government organisations cannot keep our data safe, and this is supposed to be a free country, how can a country be free when we are being monitored? We have nothing to hide, and deem this as a gross invasion of privacy, and would like the idea to be scrapped.
